subject: GSJ
title: Unruly Women in Early Modern Hispanic Culture
description: This course will examine works by and about women in early modern Hispanic culture (16th and 17th centuries), with  particular attention to engagements with and subversions of patriarchal culture in theatre, prose, and poetry. Authors to be discussed  may include, among others, Santa Teresa de Avila, Sor Juana Ines de la Cruz, Maria de Zayas, and Ana Caro. [Note: Taught in English.]
